segments.text: I notice the water overflowing from the sink, creating a real mess on the floor.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: It's just pouring out, like a little waterfall, and no one seems to care.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I think it's really wasteful, all that water just going to waste like that.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I wonder how long it's been like that, with the water just flowing onto the floor.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I can see the woman standing in the puddle, like it's the most normal thing in the world.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I hope someone turns off the faucet soon, before the water causes any real damage.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: It's a bit frustrating, seeing all that water just going to waste like that.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I think the woman should be more careful, paying attention to what's going on around her.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I wonder if she'll notice the water once it starts soaking her dress.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I feel a bit bad for her, she's going to have a big mess to clean up once she finally notices the water.
segments.speaker: PAR
